pullRequest.title: Enhanced the output with stats about JITClient specific Activity
pullRequest.bodyText:
Added how many compilations will be remote and how many messages of each specific type were sent
issue: #9339
Signed-off-by: Eman Elsabban eman.elsaban1@gmail.com

nodes.bodyText:
Since this code is only used for JITServer we need to protect it with
#if defined(J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER)
See other parts of the code for an example
This code prints the same message stats a few times (for each opt level). Here we want stats about the remote compilations, not about messages.
JITServer specific code needs to be protected by #ifdef J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER
Also, please change JITServerHelpers::printJITServerMsgStats(); to display total number of messages and average number of messages per compilation.

Fields should start with underscores.
However, in this case I don't think we need totalNumRemoteCompilations or totalMsgCount. They can be computed on demand

beforeCommit.message:
Addressed Marius Comments

printed the total messages and the average number of messages per compilation by divinding total number of messages by total number of compilations
issue: #9339

Signed-off-by: Eman Elsabban <eman.elsaban1@gmail.com>

afterCommit.message:
Addressed Marius Comments

printed the total messages and the average number of messages per compilation by divinding total number of messages by total number of compilations
issue: #9339

Signed-off-by: Eman Elsabban <eman.elsaban1@gmail.com>

nodes.bodyText: We need a check that JITServerHelpers::serverMsgTypeCount[0] is not 0. Otherwise the JVM will crash when doing division by 0
This will not work on a build that does not have J9VM_OPT_JITSERVER defined because _statsRemoteOptLevels is going to be undefined.
You don't have to call JITServerHelpers::printJITServerMsgStats(jitConfig); because it's already called in jitShutdown where it prints stats about messages
